Re: License #: CB410284045
Dear CHAR M LANNING:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
November 13, 2023. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The facility did not request or require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility did not request or require consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment reports the agency was not under a Corrective
Action Plan the previous review period. The Chief Administrator (CA) did not report
experiencing any challenges or barriers to achieve compliance. The agency adapted
or is in the process of adapting to the new licensing requirements. The CA expressed
confidence the agency will continue to achieve overall compliance.
Financial Overview
Financial records were reviewed and there were no concerns identified.
2

Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were conducted with two staff face-to-face at the agency. Staff reported
some frustration regarding the length of time to receive fingerprint results but did
not have any specific concerns regarding the day-to-day operations at the agency.
Staff reported feeling supported by supervision and coworkers.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of adoption services.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
________________________________11/14/2023______
